name: timeSeriesChartUtilities
label: Time Series Chart Utilities
description: When using the Time Series Chart Solution Pack, this connector is used by the included playbooks to facilitate the creation of data-over-time or time series charts. The included functions include building a list of datetime-buckets, as well as various utilities to process the output of dataset queries for use by the Time Series Widget.

operations.title: Assemble Query Time Windows
operations.description: Takes relative date (last x days, for example), time period (hourly, daily, etc), date format string, plus optionally a list of existing datetimes and builds a list of time buckets from them spanning the time window specified by the relative date information.

parameters.title: Relative Date
parameters.name: relativeDate
parameters.description: this is generally going to come directly from the Time Series Chart record for a specific chart.

parameters.title: Time Period
parameters.name: time_period
parameters.tooltip: The time interval which you want to use as the time bucket duration on your chart.

parameters.title: Date Format String
parameters.name: dateFormatString
parameters.tooltip: How dates are expected to be formatted in the chart JSON

parameters.title: Existing Times
parameters.name: existing_times
parameters.tooltip: The list of times currently shown in the chart, if the chart has previously been generated

parameters.title: Query Modified
parameters.name: query_modified
parameters.tooltip: Whether the chart definition has been modified since the last time data was fetched. If so, all time windows will be re-queried and existing data overwritten.

operations.title: Flatten Data Sets and Groups
operations.description: Takes Data Set and Data Set Group information and outputs the flattened list of data sets to query, a list of Data Sets which should be grouped together, and a dictionary of Data Sets with specified plot types. This data set information will come from configuring the Time Series Charts widget.

parameters.title: Data Sets
parameters.name: dataSets
parameters.tooltip: This is the JSON-formatted data from the TimeSeries Chart widget configuration. Each Data Set will have its own query and list of filters, potentially with the results grouped based on a picklist field.

operations.title: Format Data Set Output with Field-Grouped
operations.description: Takes the query output for a Data Set which the user specified to be grouped on a field value and formats this output to be consistent with how the widget will render the chart.

parameters.title: Query Output
parameters.name: queryOutput
parameters.description: The output of a Query step, which runs a Data Set's query once for each time bucket which must be queried
parameters.tooltip: This should be a List of Lists, with one List per time bucket to be queried

parameters.title: Time Buckets Queried
parameters.name: timeBucketsQueried
parameters.description: A List of Dictionaries respresenting the start and end timestamps of each time bucket queried

parameters.title: Data Set Configuration
parameters.name: dataSetConfiguration
parameters.description: The configuration options selected for this Data Set when configuring the Time Series Chart Widget
parameters.tooltip: This will be a JSON object containing the Data Set's title, plot type, query information, and grouping information

operations.title: Combine Query Results into Data Columns
operations.description: Takes the processed output of all data set queries, plus existing chart data and the results of the "Assemble Query Time Windows" operation and puts together the final data columns to be rendered in the chart.

parameters.title: Playbook Mode
parameters.name: playbookMode
parameters.description: This will dictate whether the output includes previous results, or whether they will be overwritten
parameters.tooltip: Either "new_chart" or "update_buckets", based on the output of "Assemble Query Time Windows"

parameters.title: First Index to Keep
parameters.name: firstIndexToKeep
parameters.description: Data prior to this index will be discarded
parameters.tooltip: When updating an existing table, this is the index of each existing data column which will be keps as the first index of the new column

parameters.title: Queried Time Buckets
parameters.name: queriedTimeBuckets
parameters.description: A List of Dictionaries respresenting the start and end timestamps of each time bucket queried
parameters.tooltip: This should be the 'query_buckets' output of the "Assemble Query Time Windows" operation

parameters.title: Query Results
parameters.name: queryResults
parameters.description: The results of the queries run for all data sets. This should be the output of the "Run Queries" Playbook step
parameters.tooltip: This should be a List of Dictionaries, each containing an attribute called "quantities"

parameters.title: Existing Data Columns
parameters.name: existingDataColumns
parameters.description: When appending data to an existing chart, this should be the data already present in the chart
parameters.tooltip: When no such data is present, an empty List may be used instead
